content.prompt: Which of the following best helps to explain why hexane has a higher boiling point than methanol has?

choices.label: Methanol molecules can form hydrogen bonds with other methanol molecules.
Hexane cannot form hydrogen bonds with other hexane molecules.
Methanol molecules have attractions to one another due to London dispersion forces.
Hexane molecules have electron clouds that are larger than those of methanol molecules.

skill.text: 4.C: Explain the connection between particulate-level and macroscopic properties of a substance using models and representations.
